students.name: Anna Liu
students.learningGoalsNarrative: I want to develop stronger presentation skills because I get nervous speaking in front of groups. I'm also really curious about how organizations actually use data to make decisions—we talk about it in class but I want to see it in practice. I'd love to build more confidence talking with senior professionals and figure out how my psychology background could apply in a business setting.
students.careerInterestsNarrative: I'm exploring careers in HR, organizational consulting, or market research. I've always been fascinated by what motivates people and how groups work together. I want to find a role where I can use psychological principles to help organizations and the people in them thrive.

students.name: Ben Williams
extractedSkills: Basic graphic design (Canva, Adobe Creative Suite)
students.learningGoalsNarrative: I want real experience working with actual clients, not just classroom simulations. I need to get better at taking complex or technical information and making it accessible for different audiences. I also want to improve my project management abilities—keeping track of multiple deliverables and deadlines. Most importantly, I want to graduate with professional work samples I can show employers.
students.careerInterestsNarrative: I'm targeting corporate communications, PR agencies, or in-house content strategy roles. I want a career that lets me be creative but also think strategically about how messages land with different audiences. I'm drawn to fast-paced environments where I can see the impact of my work.
